{"step_by_step_thinking": "The upper first molar, also known as the maxillary first molar, is a tooth in the human dentition. It typically has four cusps, and the number of fossae corresponds to the number of cusps. Each cusp has a major fossa, and there are also minor fossae between the cusps. Therefore, the upper first molar should have 4 major fossae and 2 minor fossae.", "answer_choice": "B. 3 major 2 minor"}
